I am an independent consultant, working from my home office. Formally, I maintain 9 to 5 office hours, but I work nights and weekends too. For the most part I have no set work hours, my personal and work time overlap 24/7. Clients call me at all hours. The long and short of it is that I get paid, and paid well, for my knowledge and skills--not my time--and I manage my own time. Which is exactly what I set out to do in life.
BTW that 5% is far from guaranteed skipper.
thanks man! i signed up
I agree no equities dividend is guaranteed, now if you look at cash versus debt, the only dividend i see that might be guarantted is microsoft...

Nothing in life is guaranteed. But, I don't think T will cut it's dividend. Hey, who knows, perhaps the world will end soon. The shares still represent real assets Many properties are held on the books at the original costs. They are worth much more now. For example, the main switch office in San Diego (Belmont) was built early last century. Have any idea what that block would be worth today? Railroads still carry valuable prperty granted to them in the 1800's at $1 per acre.
I buy every quarter with my dividends from 6200 shares. I've used DCA for many years now with a DRIP program. I have a good profit built in with T, several other stocks and 3 mutual funds.
